segment.source: Windows Assessment Toolkit
segment.target: Windows Assessment Toolkit

segment.source: The Windows Assessment Toolkit helps you determine the quality of a running operating system or a set of components with regard to performance, reliability, and functionality.
segment.target: The Windows Assessment Toolkit helps you determine the quality of a running operating system or a set of components with regard to performance, reliability, and functionality.

segment.source: Windows Assessment Toolkit
segment.target: Windows Assessment Toolkit

segment.source: The Windows Assessment Toolkit helps you determine the quality of a running operating system or a set of components with regard to performance, reliability, and functionality.
segment.target: The Windows Assessment Toolkit helps you determine the quality of a running operating system or a set of components with regard to performance, reliability, and functionality.

segment.source: The Windows Assessment Toolkit is included with the Windows ADK.
segment.target: The Windows Assessment Toolkit is included with the Windows ADK.

segment.source: The Windows Assessment Toolkit includes the tools that you need to assess a local computer, review the results, diagnose problems, and determine how to make improvements.
segment.target: The Windows Assessment Toolkit includes the tools that you need to assess a local computer, review the results, diagnose problems, and determine how to make improvements.

segment.source: When you install the toolkit, you get:
segment.target: When you install the toolkit, you get:

segment.source: The Windows Assessment Console.
segment.target: The Windows Assessment Console.

segment.source: A GUI that you can use to group the assessments, create a job, run the job, and view and manage the job results.
segment.target: A GUI that you can use to group the assessments, create a job, run the job, and view and manage the job results.

segment.source: A job is a collection of one or more assessments, and their settings, that run together on a computer.
segment.target: A job is a collection of one or more assessments, and their settings, that run together on a computer.

segment.source: Assessments.
segment.target: Assessments.

segment.source: A combination of .xml and binary files that induce a specific set of states on a computer, measure and record the activity, and preserve the recorded results.
segment.target: A combination of .xml and binary files that induce a specific set of states on a computer, measure and record the activity, and preserve the recorded results.

segment.source: The results often include diagnostics and remediation information that help you determine areas that need additional investigation and corrective action.
segment.target: The results often include diagnostics and remediation information that help you determine areas that need additional investigation and corrective action.

segment.source: The Assessment Platform.
segment.target: The Assessment Platform.

segment.source: The infrastructure for developing and extending assessments, and for consistently running and displaying jobs, assessments, and results.
segment.target: The infrastructure for developing and extending assessments, and for consistently running and displaying jobs, assessments, and results.

segment.source: In This Section
segment.target: In This Section

segment.source: Assessment Platform Command-Line Syntax
segment.target: Assessment Platform Command-Line Syntax

segment.source: Learn how to use the AXE.exe command-line tool (installed with the Windows Assessment Toolkit) to automate jobs from a script and minimize resource usage.
segment.target: Learn how to use the AXE.exe command-line tool (installed with the Windows Assessment Toolkit) to automate jobs from a script and minimize resource usage.

segment.source: Windows Assessment Console
segment.target: Windows Assessment Console

segment.source: Learn how the Windows Assessment Console works, and how you can use it to configure and run assessments on a local computer.
segment.target: Learn how the Windows Assessment Console works, and how you can use it to configure and run assessments on a local computer.

segment.source: Windows Assessment Services
segment.target: Windows Assessment Services

segment.source: Learn how to use the Windows Assessment Services to automate running assessments; eliminate fragmented, error-prone, expensive pre-deployment processes; and replace multiple steps and tools with just one tool.
segment.target: Learn how to use the Windows Assessment Services to automate running assessments; eliminate fragmented, error-prone, expensive pre-deployment processes; and replace multiple steps and tools with just one tool.

segment.source: Windows Assessment Services is included with the Windows ADK.
segment.target: Windows Assessment Services is included with the Windows ADK.

segment.source: Windows Assessment Toolkit Technical Reference
segment.target: Windows Assessment Toolkit Technical Reference

segment.source: View the assessments and the command-line syntax for the assessment platform.
segment.target: View the assessments and the command-line syntax for the assessment platform.
